alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:19PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jackson and southeastern DeKalb Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 318 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Henagar, or 12 miles north of Fort Payne, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Payne, Rainsville, Henagar, Sylvania, Powell, Section, Valley Head, Hammondville, Mentone and Dutton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
